page.title: 03Life of a Wroxall farmer.
page.content: My grandad is a farmer. He has a 110 acres, with 58 cows and 42 heifers, 40 are Friesians and 18 Ayrshires. He rears his own calves and they come into the stable when they are about 2 and a half years old.He milks the cows at six o'clock in the morning and at 3 o'clock in the afternoon.Most days 2 ladies do the milk round from 9 a.m. to 12 a.m. He employs a girl to wash the milk bottles in the morning. Grandad does the hay making as soon as the weather looks settled in June. He has worked and then farmed for 46 years.He says the biggest changes are that now he has milking machines and farmers keep more cows than they did. They use fertilizer on the grass to make it grow more to feed the extra cows. He also used to use horses where as now he has tractors.
